CodeList.Name: Neuropsychiatric Inventory Test Code

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have beliefs that you know are not true? (for example, insisting that people are trying to harm him/her or steal from him/her)? Has he/she said that family members are not who they say they are or that the house is not their home? I'm not asking about mere suspiciousness; I am interested if the patient is convinced that these things are happening to him/her.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Have Beliefs That You Know are Not True

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient believe that he/she is in danger - that others are planning to hurt him/her?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - He/She is in Danger

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient believe that others are stealing from him/her?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Others are Stealing From Him/Her

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient believe that his/her spouse is having an affair?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - His/Her Spouse is Having an Affair

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient believe that unwelcome guests are living in his/her house?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Unwelcome Guests are Living in His/Her House

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient believe that his/her spouse or others are not who they claim to be?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - His/Her Spouse or Others Are Not Who They Claim To Be

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient believe that his/her house is not his/her home?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - His/Her House Is Not His/Her Home

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient believe that family members plan to abandon him/her?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Family Members Plan to Abandon Him/Her

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient believe that television or magazine figures are actually present in the home? (Does he/she try to talk or interact with them?)
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Television or Magazine Figures Are Actually Present In the Home

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient believe any other unusual things that I haven't asked about?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Any Other Unusual Things That I Haven't Asked About

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the delusions.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Delusions Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the delusions.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Delusions Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Delusions Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Delusions: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Delusions FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have hallucinations such as seeing false visions or hearing false voices? Does he/she seem to see, hear or experience things that are not present? By this question we do not mean just mistaken beliefs such as stating that someone who has died is still alive; rather we are asking if the patient actually has abnormal experiences of sounds or visions.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Hallucinations Such as Seeing False Visions or Hearing False Voices

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient describe hearing voices or act as if he/she hears voices?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Describe Hearing Voices or Act as if He/She Hears Voices

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient talk to people who are not there?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Talk to People Who Are Not There

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: NPI1-See Things Not Seen by Others
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient describe seeing things not seen by others or behave as if he/she is seeing things not seen by others (people, animals, lights, etc.)?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Describe Seeing Things Not Seen by Others

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: NPI1-Smell Odors Others Do Not Smell
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient report smelling odors not smelled by others?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Report Smelling Odors Not Smelled by Others

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient describe feeling things on his/her skin or otherwise appear to be feeling things crawling or touching him/her?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Describe Feeling Things on His/Her Skin

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient describe tastes that are without any known cause?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Describe Tastes That Are Without Any Known Cause

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient describe any other unusual sensory experiences?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Describe Any Other Unusual Sensory Experiences

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the hallucinations.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Hallucinations Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the hallucinations.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Hallucinations Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Hallucinations Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Hallucinations: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Hallucinations FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have periods when he/she refuses to cooperate or won't let people help him/her? Is he/she hard to handle?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Periods When He/She Refuses to Cooperate

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient get upset with those trying to care for him/her or resist activities such as bathing or changing clothes?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Get Upset with Those Trying to Care for Him/Her

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Is the patient stubborn, having to have things his/her way?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Stubborn

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Is the patient uncooperative, resistive to help from others?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Uncooperative

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have any other behaviors that make him/her hard to handle?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Any Other Behaviors That Make Him/Her Hard to Handle

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient shout or curse angrily?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Shout or Curse Angrily

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient slam doors, kick furniture, throw things?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Slam doors, Kick Furniture, Throw Things

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient attempt to hurt or hit others?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Attempt to Hurt or Hit Others

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have any other aggressive or agitated behaviors?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Any Other Aggressive or Agitated Behaviors

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the agitation/aggression.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Agitation/Aggression Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the agitation/aggression.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Agitation/Aggression Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Agitation/Aggression Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Agitation/Aggression: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Agitation/Aggression FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient seem sad or depressed? Does he/she say that he/she feels sad or depressed?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Seem Sad or Depressed

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have periods of tearfulness or sobbing that seem to indicate sadness?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Periods of Tearfulness or Sobbing

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: NPI1-Say or Act in Low Spirits
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient say, or act as if he/she is sad or in low spirits?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Say, or Act as if He/She is Sad or in Low Spirits

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient put him/herself down or say that he/she feels like a failure?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Put Him/Herself Down or Say That He/She Feels Like a Failure

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient say that he/she is a bad person or deserves to be punished?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Say That He/She is a Bad Person

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient seem very discouraged or say that he/she has no future?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Seem Very Discouraged

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient say he/she is a burden to the family or that the family would be better off without him/her?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Say He/She is a Burden to the Family

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient express a wish for death or talk about killing himself/herself?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Express a Wish for Death

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient show any other signs of depression or sadness?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Show Any Other Signs of Depression or Sadness

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the depression/dysphoria.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Depression/Dysphoria Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the depression/dysphoria.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Depression/Dysphoria Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Depression/Dysphoria Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Depression/Dysphoria: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Depression/Dysphoria FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Sub-total of distress score.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - NPI Total Distress Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Is the patient very nervous, worried, or frightened for no apparent reason? Does he/she seem very tense or fidgety? Is the patient afraid to be apart from you?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Very Nervous, Worried, or Frightened for No Apparent Reason

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient say that he/she is worried about planned events?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Say That He/She is Worried About Planned Events

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have periods of feeling shaky, unable to relax, or feeling excessively tense?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Periods of Feeling Shaky, Unable to Relax, or Feeling Excessively Tense

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have periods of (or complain of) shortness of breath, gasping, or sighing for no apparent reason other than nervousness?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Periods of Shortness of Breath, Gasping, or Sighing for No Apparent Reason

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient complain of butterflies in his/her stomach, or of racing or pounding of the heart in association with nervousness? (Symptoms not explained by ill health).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Complain of Butterflies, Racing or Pounding Heart

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient avoid certain places or situations that make him/her more nervous such as riding in the car, meeting with friends, or being in crowds?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Avoid Certain Places or Situations That Make Him/Her More Nervous

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient become nervous and upset when separated from you (or his/her caregiver)? (Does he/she cling to you to keep from being separated?).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Become Nervous and Upset When Separated From You

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient show any other signs of anxiety?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Show Any Other Signs of Anxiety

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the anxiety.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Anxiety Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the anxiety.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Anxiety Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Anxiety Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Anxiety: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Anxiety FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient seem too cheerful or too happy for no reason? I don't mean the normal happiness that comes from seeing friends, receiving presents, or spending time with family members. I am asking if the patient has a persistent and abnormally good mood or finds humor where others do not.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Seem Too Cheerful or Too Happy for No Reason

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient appear to feel good or to be too happy, different from his/her usual self?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Appear to Feel Good or to Be Too Happy

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: NPI1-Humor Others Do Not Find Funny
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient find humor and laugh at things that others do not find funny?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Fine Humor and Laugh at Things That Others Do Not Find Funny

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient seem to have a childish sense of humor with a tendency to giggle or laugh inappropriately (such as when something unfortunate happens to others)?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Seem to Have a Childish Sense of Humor

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: NPI1-Jokes Others Do Not Find Funny
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient tell jokes or make remarks that are not funny to others but seem funny to him/her?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Tell Jokes or Make Remarks That are Not Funny to Others

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does he/she play childish pranks such as pinching or playing "keep away" for the fun of it?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Play Childish Pranks

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient "talk big" or claim to have more abilities or wealth than is true?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Talk Big or Claim to Have More Abilities or Wealth Than is True

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: NPI1-Other Signs of Feeling Too Happy
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient show any other signs of feeling too good or being too happy?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Show Any Other Signs of Feeling Too Good or Being Too Happy

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the elation/euphoria.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Elation/Euphoria Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the elation/euphoria.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Elation/Euphoria Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Elation/Euphoria Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Elation/Euphoria: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Elation/Euphoria FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Has the patient lost interest in the world around him/her? Has he/she lost interest in doing things or does he/she lack motivation for starting new activities? Is he/she more difficult to engage in conversation or in doing chores? Is the patient apathetic or indifferent?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Lost Interest in the World Around Him/Her

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient seem less spontaneous and less active than usual?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Seem Less Spontaneous and Less Active Than Usual

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Is the patient less likely to initiate a conversation?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Less Likely Initiate to Initiate a Conversation

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Is the patient less affectionate or lacking in emotions when compared to his/her usual self?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Less Affectionate or Lacking in Emotions

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient contribute less to household chores?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Contribute Less to Household Chores

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient seem less interested in the activities and plans of others?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Less Interested in the Activities and Plans of Others

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Has the patient lost interest in friends and family members?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Lost Interest in Friends and Family Members

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Is the patient less enthusiastic about his/her usual interests?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Less Enthusiastic About His/Her Usual Interests

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient show any other signs that he/she doesn't care about doing new things?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Show Any Other Signs That He/She Doesn't Care About Doing New Things

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the apathy/indifference.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Apathy/Indifference Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the apathy/indifference.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Apathy/Indifference Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Apathy/Indifference Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Apathy/Indifference: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Apathy/Indifference FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient seem to act impulsively without thinking? Does he/she do or say things that are not usually done or said in public? Does he/she do things that are embarrassing to you or others?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Seem to Act Impulsively Without Thinking

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient act impulsively without appearing to consider the consequences?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Act Impulsively without Appearing to Consider the Consequences

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient talk to total strangers as if he/she knew them?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Talk to Total Strangers as if He/She Knew Them

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient say things to people that are insensitive or hurt their feelings?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Say Things to People that are Insensitive

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient say crude things or make sexual remarks that he/she would not usually have said?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Say Crude Things or Make Sexual Remarks

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient talk openly about very personal or private matters not usually discussed in public?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Talk Openly About Very Personal or Private Matters

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient take liberties or touch or hug others in a way that is out of character for him/her?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Take Liberties or Touch or Hug Others

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient show any other signs of loss of control of his/her impulses?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Show Any Other Signs of Loss of Control of His/Her Impulses

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the disinhibition.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Disinhibition Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the disinhibition.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Disinhibition Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Disinhibition Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Disinhibition: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Disinhibition FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient get irritated and easily disturbed? Are his/her moods very changeable? Is he/she abnormally impatient? We do not mean frustration over memory loss or inability to perform usual tasks; we are interested to know if the patient has abnormal irritability, impatience, or rapid emotional changes different from his/her usual self.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Get Irritated and Easily Disturbed

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have a bad temper, flying "off the handle" easily over little things?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Bad Temper, Flying 'Off the Handle' Easily Over Little Things

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient rapidly change moods from one to another, being fine one minute and angry the next?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Rapidly Change Moods From One to Another

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have sudden flashes of anger?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Sudden Flares of Anger

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Is the patient impatient, having trouble coping with delays or waiting for planned activities?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Impatient, Having Trouble Coping with Delays

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Is the patient cranky and irritable?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Cranky and Irritable

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Is the patient argumentative and difficult to get along with?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Argumentative and Difficult to Get Along With

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient show any other signs of irritability?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Show Any Other Signs of Irritability

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the irritability/lability.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Irritability/Lability Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the irritability/lability.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Irritability/Lability Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Irritability/Lability Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Irritability/Lability: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Irritability/Lability FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient pace, do things over and over such as opening closets or drawers, or repeatedly pick at things or wind string or threads?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Pace, Do Things Over and Over, Repeatedly Pick at Things

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient pace around the house without apparent purpose?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Pace Around the House Without Apparent Purpose

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient rummage around opening and unpacking drawers or closets?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Rummage Around Opening and Unpacking Drawers or Closets

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient repeatedly put on and take off clothing?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Repeatedly Put On and Take Off Clothing

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have repetitive activities or "habits" that he/she performs over and over?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Repetitive Activities or 'Habits'

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient engage in repetitive activities such as handling buttons, picking, wrapping string, etc.?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Engage in Repetitive Activities

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient fidget excessively, seem unable to sit still, or bounce his/her feet or tap his/her fingers a lot?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Fidget Excessively, Seem Unable to Sit Still

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient do any other activities over and over?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Do Any Other Activities Over and Over

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the aberrant motor behavior.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Aberrant Motor Behavior Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the aberrant motor behavior.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Aberrant Motor Behavior Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Aberrant Motor Behavior Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Aberrant Motor Behavior: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Aberrant Motor Behavior FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have difficulty sleeping (do not count as present if the patient simply gets up once or twice per night to go the bathroom and falls back asleep immediately)? Is he/she up at night? Does he/she wander at night, get dressed, or disturb your sleep?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Difficulty Sleeping

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have difficulty falling asleep?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Difficulty Falling Asleep

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient get up during the night (do not count if the patient gets up once or twice per night only to go to the bathroom and falls back asleep immediately)?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Get Up During the Night

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient wander, pace or get involved in inappropriate activities at night?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Wander, Pace or Get Involved in Inappropriate Activities at Night

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient awaken you during the night?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Awaken You During the Night

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: NPI1-Wake at Night and Think Morning
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient wake up at night, dress, and plan to go out thinking that it is morning and time to start the day?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Wake Up at Night, Dress, and Plan to Go Out

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient awaken too early in the morning (earlier than was his/her habit)?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Awaken Too Early in Morning

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient sleep excessively during the day?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Sleep Excessively During the Day

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Does the patient have any other nighttime behaviors that bother you that we haven't talked about?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Any Other Nighttime Behaviors That Bother You

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the nighttime behavior.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Sleep and Nighttime Behavior Disorders Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the nighttime behavior.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Sleep and Nighttime Behavior Disorders Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Sleep and Nighttime Behavior Disorders Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Sleep and Nighttime Behavior Disorders: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Sleep/Night Behavior Disorder FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Has he/she had any change in appetite, weight, or eating habits (count as NA if the patient is incapacitated and has to be fed)? Has there been any change in the type of food he/she prefers?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Change in Appetite, Weight, or Eating Habits

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Has he/she had a loss of appetite?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Loss of Appetite

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Has he/she had an increase in appetite?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Increase in Appetite

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Has he/she had a loss of weight?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Loss of Weight

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Has he/she gained weight?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Gained Weight

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Has he/she had a change in eating behavior such as putting too much food in his/her mouth at once?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Change in Eating Behavior

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Has he/she had a change in the kind of food he/she likes such as eating too many sweets or other specific types of food?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Change in Kind of Food He/She Likes

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Has he/she developed eating behaviors such as eating exactly the same types of food each day or eating the food in exactly the same order?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Developed Eating Behaviors Such as Eating Exactly the Same Types of Food

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Have there been any other changes in appetite or eating that I haven't asked about?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Any Other Changes in Appetite or Eating

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Frequency of the changes in eating habits or appetite.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Appetite and Eating Disorders Frequency

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Severity of the changes in eating habits or appetite.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Appetite and Eating Disorders Severity

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - How emotionally distressing do you find this behavior?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Appetite and Eating Disorders Distress

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Appetite and Eating Disorders: (frequency score x severity score).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - Appetite/Eating Disorders FxS Score

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Total of (Frequency Sub-total) x (Severity Sub-total).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: NPI - NPI Total Score

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC Questionnaire NPI Test Code Terminology
